intro: Wissadula wissaduloides, commonly known as the golden star cactus, is a species native to southern Africa. It is a succulent plant characterized by its cylindrical stems and yellow to orange flowers. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Wissadula wissaduloides is relatively drought-tolerant and suitable for arid climates.
